thread.title: The Ad the New York Times Is Airing During the Oscars Is Explosive
thread.title_full: The Ad the New York Times Is Airing During the Oscars Is Explosive

author: Cosmopolitan.com
title: The Ad the New York Times Is Airing During the Oscars Is Explosive
text:
Wow, this ad the New York Times plans on screening during the Oscars is a doozy.
The 30-second ad starts with some writing on the screen: “The truth is our nation is more divided than ever.” It then includes audio of different voices from news clips, with contradictory statements flashing across the screen, such as “alternative facts are lies,” “the media is dishonest,” “women should dress like women” and “women’s rights are human rights.”
It closes with: “The truth is hard. The truth is hard to find. The truth is hard to know. The truth is more important now than ever.”
According to the Associated Press, this is their first TV commercial since 2010. It comes just two days after The Times , CNN, the Los Angeles Times , other several other news organizations were denied entry to a press briefing .
Follow Laura on Twitter .
